ThingDef.label: barn owl
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized owl with a distinctive, heart-shaped face. They are renowned for their eerie, drawn-out shrieking calls. Barn owls prey upon small mammals which they locate with their excellent hearing.

ThingDef.label: eagle owl
ThingDef.description: One of the largest species of owl, the eagle-owl has characteristic ear tufts, orange eyes and an 'Uhu' call that makes it instantly recognisable. Due to its large size, it can take a wide variety of prey but typically favours small mammals and birds.

ThingDef.label: Kestrel
ThingDef.description: A falcon noted for the prominent sexual dimorphism of their plumage, with the males having a blue-grey cap. The kestrel feeds almost exclusively upon small mammals, aided by its ability to see near ultraviolet light, and performs a characteristic hovering flight whilst hunting.

ThingDef.label: crow
ThingDef.description: A passerine in the corvid family, the crow is a highly intelligent bird that sustains itself primarily through scavenging, although it will forage on occasion. Due to their dietary habits, they have been considered ill-omens, and associated with war and the occult.

ThingDef.label: budgerigar
ThingDef.description: A well known pet bird. Outgoing and curious.

ThingDef.label: cockatiel
ThingDef.description: A well known pet bird. Known for screaming and it's ability to whistle.

ThingDef.label: macaw
ThingDef.description: A well known big pet bird. Known for screaming and it's ability to mimic. Craves human contact.

ThingDef.label: peregrine falcon
ThingDef.description: The peregrine is renowned for its speed, reaching over 320 km/h (200 mph) during its characteristic hunting stoop. As is typical for bird-eating raptors, peregrine falcons are sexually dimorphic, with females being considerably larger than males.

ThingDef.label: raven
ThingDef.description: Large all-black passerine bird. Common ravens have coexisted with humans for thousands of years and in some areas have been so numerous that people have regarded them as pests. Some notable feats of problem-solving provide evidence that the common raven is unusually intelligent.

ThingDef.label: red wing blackbird
ThingDef.description: The Redwing Blackbird is a songbird found in wetland areas, with a distinctive song. They can be aggressive when their territory is encroached. They usually cluster in very large flocks.

ThingDef.label: vulture
ThingDef.description: Medium sized birds of prey, which are known for eating carrion.
